review_title: College that focuses on students and employee success
pros: Focus on students Fantastic teamwork and communication
cons: Limited hours and opportunities for advancement

review_title: Student Assistant is A Good Position for Students
pros: - Good for people who are students and want to work part-time for a monthly allowance. - Time of working is flexible due to each tutor's personal schedule. - If you ace all course contents of the subject you teach, should be easy enough to work and less stressful.
cons: - The salary is in the minimum wage, and might not be good if you want to save more money. - Many of the students might have anxieties and you should be capable of dealing with those situations (in my case, I took an extra teaching course for it).

pros: Can choose your own hours. Work closely with professors. Get to know students
cons: Paid minimum wage while having to cover tutoring for multiple classes (depending on how good you are). It can definitely take up more time than what you getting paid, but the work experience is worth it in my opinion to get your foot in the door

pros: You get to practice what you know and meet new people
cons: you are limited to 8 hours a week

pros: The salaries are good. Vibrant students.
cons: --top down management style --toxic leadership --decisions driven by personalities not principles --lack of job security; capricious decision-making --unions and faculty leadership are often obstructionistic.

job_title: Av systems coordinator in Walnut, CA
pros: 18 paid holidays per year, plus 12 vacation days each year.
cons: Somewhat understaffed in several areas, making it difficult to provide the best support to the students and faculty. A tendency to wait too long to hire workers permanently that are clearly needed to manage the typical workload, keeping them as temporary workers instead.

pros: The student population is incredible. Mt. SAC serve predominantly low-income, first-generation students who come from marginalized backgrounds. Every student that I have worked with is incredible resilient, inspirational, and full of potential. The students at this college make this college an amazing place to work at.
cons: Antiquated work culture where productivity and speed are praised.

cons: There were hardly any cons. The pay was probably the only downside but as a student, I couldn't expect more.

job_title: Computer Lab Instructor for Staff Development in Walnut, CA
pros:
Years ago I worked Staff Development at Mt San Antonio College under Dck (Richard) Ryerson.
The people I worked with are awesome. 
The teachers that go in there are positive.  They come to learn new things.  
Training other people means you are constantly learning things also.
Best job ever.
cons:
I left because the job was part-time with no benefits.  I traded three part-time jobs for one full time job, and I can't say that it was a good choice.   Full time positions at MSAC were scarce.  But, sticking it out may have been better.  

That's pretty much the only bad thing about working here,,, having to make that choice between your immediate family needs and the brass ring.

review_title: Excellent place to work, thus far.
pros:
Competitive salary
Flexible schedule
Good benefits package
Good management team
Very generous vacation/PTO programs


The majority of people are wonderful and love what they do. Working for an educational institution empowers you and really makes you feel like your work actually makes a difference in the lives of others.
cons:
No real inner-campus job advancement benefit. When hiring new employees they always look for the best fit, even if it means hiring somebody from the outside.

Very little, if any benefit at all for employees who are students. No paid tuition, no priority registration, etc. Understandable since the economy isn't at its best right now.

Some departmental politics, but not too much. You're going to find that anywhere you go, so just get used to it.

pros: There a lot of of good people in the Department I worked at. I learned a great deal from the 5 years that I was there. Very busy but very steady work. Everyone is very respectful and have been there for a long time so they have a lot of experience to offer.  The flexible work hours worked out well for working moms. Lots of holidays (22 holidays to be exact), generous vacation, and good pay.
cons: The politics can get heavy at time. Some unfairness but if you can't avoid that. Lots of work.

review_title: The educational environment is rewarding, but advancement opportunities are nearly non-existent.
job_title: Computer Facilities Assistant in Walnut, CA
pros: Solving problems and helping students is very rewarding. The pay and vacation time are quite good, even for part timers. For the most part it is a pretty relaxed atmosphere.
cons: The hiring policy seems designed to stop anyone from moving up internally. Going from part time to full time is very unlikely. Management seems largely deaf to the suggestions and complaints of lower level employees.

pros: A great place to work as a student part time. Most of the administrators that you work for will try to work with your class schedule and the environment, while at times can be demanding, is overall relaxed.
cons: The same issues with this job are those that you'd have with practically any other job, especially those dealing with customer service.

job_title: Student Assistant III in Walnut, CA
pros: The working environment is great. I worked there for 2 years as a tutor before transferring. It's a relaxed work environment unless exams and finals are coming up.
cons: Sometimes there are a little tight on sign in and sign out rules. It's a minor con but not really an issue at all as long as you keep your ID.

review_title: This is a good place to work.
pros: Excellent people, good salaries, good benefits, a wide variety of students, the opportunity to make a very real difference in the lives of first generation college students.
cons: Large, bureaucratic structure.  Located in the Inland Empire--an unappealing area of Southern California, to be sure.

review_title: Supportive staff and admin, well equipped, focus on students.
pros: Students and quality instruction were priorities. Admin and staff very supportive with ideas, logistics, and equipment when available. Classrooms had a computer, Elmo (doc projector), and digital projector, Teachers had in-service participation and PD opportunities. There was a fair amount of collaboration and productive planning. Pay was reasonable.
cons: There were no F/T options; total hours at the college limited to 60%.

review_title: Mostly Good, but the Bad is Really Bad
job_title: ESL Adjunct Professor in Walnut, CA
pros: Pays well - better than most community colleges in the area. Students are great and hardworking. College and department offers a lot of professional development. Overall, coworkers are very friendly, helpful, and supportive.
cons: Part-time employees can be treated as disposable. There is a big difference in how full time and part time teachers are treated. Full time jobs are hard to come by. Sometimes management does not put students first.

review_title: Mt. SAC, Tutor in the Classroom (TC) for The Writing Center
job_title: Student Assistant IV in Walnut, CA
pros:
*Great Experience for those considering becoming a teacher/professor
*Professional development/conference oportunities
*Work on campus while a student
*Learn to plan lessons
*Instruct classes
*Practice teaching, public speaking, presentation, and research skills
*Be mentored by English professors and supervisors
cons:
*Work more hours than financially compensated for
*Pay is on the lower end of being competitive
*No benefits
*Questionable/shady paperwork practices

pros: Good experience because it allows you to understand the mechanics of the relationship between students and faculty. You get exposed to regional politic systems.
cons: Time costly. If you do not like politics or service this is not the place for you

pros:
Great staff support. Good interactive opportunities for continuing ed and professional in-service.
Respectful students, most are working adults.
cons: Sometimes classes are crowded. The vast majority of instructor positions are adjunct without job security which depends on student enrollment. Also, few benefits are available.

pros: Flexible schedule (very accommodating to class schedule), satisfaction from teaching students and experiencing their "A HA!" moment, competitive pay, opportunity for a raise by taking tutor training courses, can do homework when the students don't need help.
cons: As far as I can remember, there are no cons.

cons: I’ve worked here two semesters and really have no comments to add.

pros: Friendly working environment, both students and teachers are fun to work with. Hiring is fast, unlike big companies which take takes forever, some position only takes a few days
